wikipedia_page.main: Catherine "Kate" Belinda Finn (born 16 December 1864 in Cork; died 8 March 1932 in London) was a British chess player. She became the first British Women's Chess Champion in 1904 and defended her title in 1905.

response: * The first British Chess Championship organized by the British Chess Federation is held in Hastings.  William Ewart Napier wins the men's championship and Kate Belinda Finn wins the women's championship.
